definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: SunHao foursquare to lend money to hin son, make hin for his son manner transformation.
sentences.chinese: 孫浩直爽地借錢給欣兒，令欣兒對他態度轉變。

sentences.english: John is very free with his advice.
The intonation and tone of the northern dialect reflect the forthright character of northerners.
sentences.chinese: 北方話的語音語氣能夠表現出北方人的直爽豪邁。

sentences.english: He is a forthright person and always talks bluntly.
sentences.chinese: 他是個直爽的人，向來都是直話直說。

sentences.english: Aunty Henny was an outgoing but reticent person.
sentences.chinese: 漢妮伯母是個直爽但又沉默寡言的人。

sentences.english: Ellie, from North London, is much more blunt in her approach.
sentences.chinese: 埃莉，來自北倫敦，她的做法更直爽。

sentences.english: Her direct simplicity put him at his ease.
sentences.chinese: 她那天真直爽的態度叫他覺得安心。

sentences.english: He is a blunt man who I admire.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個我欣賞的直爽的人。

definition: frank and outspoken (idiom)/straight speaking/to say what one thinks
going directly (without detour)/(fig.) direct/straightforward (in one's manner or speech)
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
